content.description: Sit start on the left most lay-back flake line. Work your way up, following the obvious line full of solid holds to the vertical crease near the top. From here, use slopers around the arete to pull the top out into the annoying tree branch jungle on top.
content.location: First route from the left on the lower wizardry boulder. Starts on the lower-left flake line.

content.description: SDS on the left block under the holly tree. Climb directly up to the surprisingly un-positve nose.
content.location: On the downhill-side of the second boulder the trail crosses. This route starts on the obvious block crammed under the holly tree.

content.description: Start as marked on the photo, travers left to an eventual top out.
Climb right and finish just before passing the tree growing into the boulder edge (don't dab)!
content.location: Shared SDS w. Voldemort and finishes up and to the right. Top out is right by the small tree growing into the edge of the boulder.

content.description: Same start as Whomping Willow, but continue past the vertical crack and work your way up and around the "nose" of the boulder.  Get your feet to the small ledge and top out using the ribbons of positive slopers.  **CAUTION**  Much of this boulder is very soft sandstone.  A wire brush will score the rock and even nylon bristles will with enough pressure.  Be gentle with any brushing.  Also a risk for holds breaking.  The original jug for topping out broke during development.
content.location: Same boulder as Whomping Willow within the Wizardly Boulders.

content.description: A couple short boulders with a few easy problems and potential for a couple more just downhill from the trail.
